lead_intro: Learn about the fascinating world of itching and its importance in survival across various species.

quiz.question: What releases the feel-good hormone serotonin when you scratch an itch?
quiz.explanation: Scratching an itch sends a signal to your muscles, which then release the feel-good hormone serotonin.

quiz.question: Approximately how many people suffer from chronic itch?
quiz.explanation: Around one in five people suffer from chronic itch at least once.

quiz.question: What can help calm an overactive itch in chronic cases?
quiz.explanation: Medications and stress management can help calm an overactive itch in chronic cases.

quiz.question: What is a potential side effect of some medicines mentioned in the text?
quiz.explanation: Some medicines can cause itching as a side effect, leading individuals to lower their dose of life-saving drugs.

quiz.question: What triggers itching besides bugs and bites according to the text?
quiz.explanation: Itching can be triggered by a range of causes, including psychological factors, besides bugs and bites.
